data.title: Arsenal transfer news LIVE: Gunners pursuing £70m Gyokeres, Mikel Merino deal 'close', Marseille in for Nketiah

data.text:
Live Blog

GUNNERS LATEST

Arsenal transfer news LIVE: Gunners pursuing £70m Gyokeres, Mikel Merino deal ‘close’, Marseille in for Nketiah

New Eddie Nketiah offer

Arsenal favourites to sign Mikel Merino

Arsenal pushing for Viktor Gyokeres

ARSENAL are reportedly ramping up their interest in Sporting Lisbon talisman Viktor Gyokeres.

Meanwhile, the Gunners are reportedly closing in on a sensational deal to bring Euro 2024 winner Mikel Merino to the Emirates.

Elsewhere, Marseille have sent a new bid from Arsenal striker Eddie Nketiah, according to reports.

FOOTBALL FREE BETS AND SIGN UP DEALS

Follow all the latest news, moves and completed deals below

Lyon XI

Lyon ace Ainsley Maitland-Niles starts against his former club at the Emirates!

Lyon XI: Perri, Mata, Caleta-Car, Niakhate, Abner, Matic, Maitland-Niles, Caqueret, Tolisso, Benrahma, Mikautadze

Subs: Lopes, Tagliafico, Balde, Orban, Lima Silva, Kumbedi, Sarr, Mangala, Bengui, Diawara, Nuamah.

Follow all the live action in SunSport’s live blog HERE

Arsenal vs Lyon XI

Arsenal summer signing Riccardo Calafiori starts on the bench against Lyon.

Arsenal XI: Raya, White, Gabriel, Saliba, Zinchenko, Rice, Partey, Odegaard, Saka, Havertz, Martinelli

Subs: Ramsdale, Setford, Kiwior, Calafiori, Heaven, Nichols, Jorginho, Lewis-Skelly, Nelson, Nwaneri, Trossard, Jesus, Nketiah

Follow all the live action in SunSport's live blog HERE

More on Eddie Nketiah

Arsenal are continuing negotiations with Marseille regarding Eddie Nketiah.

The Gunners are in talks with L'OM over a season-long loan move with an obligatory fee of around £25million.

The French giants are yet to agree to those terms with discussions ongoing – having initially made an offer of around £17m for Nketiah last month.

Personal terms are believed to already be in place on a five-year deal for the striker.

Marseille manager Roberto De Zerbi is a fan of the England international.

Alex Oxlade-Chamberlain Exclusive

Sheffield United are making an ambitious move to sign Alex Oxlade-Chamberlain on loan from Besiktas.

Oxlade-Chamberlain was looking for a Premier League return but may now be open to a top Championship move.

The Turkish club is willing to let the ex-Arsenal ace leave this summer.

The versatile midfielder reportedly earns approximately £2.2million per season in Turkey, equating to around £42,000 per week.

Wright vs Keane

Manchester United legend Roy Keane and Arsenal great Ian Wright went viral for a hilarious video filmed just before the Community Shield.

Wright and Keane were on punditry duty for the Wembley showpiece as the latter's beloved United lost to Manchester City.

The popular duo were spotted preparing at pitchside before kick-off and were met by two content creators.

The media duo initially approached Wright who greeted them with a big hug and a nice chat.

They then met Keane who shook their hand in another relatively friendly meeting.

But one of them tried to get a little too personal to the hard Irishman's liking and went for a hug.

However, the legendary United midfielder wasn't as keen and that led to an awkward exchange.

Eddie Nketiah offer

Marseille continue to monitor Arsenal ace Eddie Nketiah during the summer transfer window.

According to transfer insider Fabrizio Romano, L'OM will make a new offer for Nketiah.

The French giants have re-opened negotiations with the Gunners for the striker.

And the 25-year-old wants to move to the Ligue 1 outfit this summer.

Mikel Merino latest

Arsenal are still favourites to land Real Sociedad star Mikel Merino in the summer transfer window.

According to El Diario Vasco, the Gunners remain Merino's most likely destination.

The report adds that the midfielder's switch is set to materialise in the coming days.

The North Londoners' manager Mikel Arteta is keen to bring the Spain international to the Emirates after he rejected other potential suitors in favour of joining Arsenal.

According to Sky Sports, however, have yet to make an offer for the 28-year-old.

Arsenal pursuing Viktor Gyokeres

Arsenal are continuing their pursuit of Sporting Lisbon star Viktor Gyokeres during the summer transfer window.

According to Corriere dello Sport, the Gunners are “very active” in their bid for Gyokeres, who could cost up to £70million.

The North Londoners are unlikely to move for Napoli star Victor Osimhen due to his expensive release clause.

Therefore, Arsenal are ramping up their interest in the Sweden international.

Ramsdale swoop

Wolves are considering a swoop for Aaron Ramsdale, with the Gunners wanting a swap deal.

Ramsdale is expected to leave the Emirates in the next month.

Gary O'Neil wants to reportedly replace Jose Sa between the sticks.

This could benefit Arsenal, who are chasing Dan Bentley.

Solanke's a Gooner

Despite signing for Spurs, Dominic Solanke once revealed he was an Arsenal fan.

He once told Match of the Day: "It would have probably been Arsenal. My Dad was an Arsenal fan, so I used to follow them.

"I went to a few Emirates Cups back in the day!"

Merino riddle

Mikel Merino was rested from a preseason friendly for Real Sociedad against Union Berlin.

However, a day later he was spotted in full training for the LaLiga club.

Reports said that it was because he was unfit.

However, a conflicting note from Fabrizio Romano suggested he wasn't risked because he's in talks with joining Arsenal.

Kiwior interest

Jakub Kiwior is a wanted man.

The Poland defender could find game time hard to come by after the signing of Riccardo Calafiori.

Now Sport Italia report that Inter Milan are interested in signing the Euro 2024 star.

The move is proposed as a loan - with an option to buy.

Toney price

Arsenal are now able to buy Ivan Toney for a cut-price £30million, according to reports.

The Times claims his club Brentford have significantly reduced his fee as his contract runs down.

The Bees are reluctant to lose their star man for nothing next summer.

Man Utd and Chelsea will also be watching his situation closely, having been previously linked with the England striker.

Ox on the move

SHEFFIELD UNITED are making an ambitious move to take Alex Oxlade-Chamberlain on loan from Turkish side Besiktas.

The former Arsenal and Liverpool midfielder, 30, was looking for a Premier League return but may now be open to a top Championship move.

The Turkish club is reportedly willing to let Oxlade-Chamberlain leave this summer.

Ex-England ace Ox played 30 times last term for the Istanbul side after arriving in August.

He scored four goals and provided one assist during his first year as Besiktas finished sixth in the Super Lig last season.

Oxlade-Chamberlain reportedly earns approximately £2.2million per season in Turkey, equating to around £42k per week.

Merino request

According to reports, Mikel Merino has asked Real Sociedad not to price him out of a move to Arsenal.

The Gunners are willing to pay around £25million for the 28-year-old.

However, his club are said to want more.

Merino has been left out of Sociedad's recent friendlies, with discussions ongoing.

Arteta's role on transfers

It's Mikel Arteta who plays a vital role on who Arsenal bring in, according to reports.

The Athletic claim the Spanish boss is a driving force when it comes to transfers, although Sporting Director Edu is in charge of scouting and negotiations.

The report adds that Riccardo Calafiori was a player Arteta was a fan of.

Nelson

Reiss Nelson has reportedly been asked to play for Jamaica.

The Arsenal winger has been capped by England at youth level, but never in the seniors.

Now Steve McLaren is hoping to take advantage of that by asking Nelson to represent the Reggae Boys.

HITC add that the wideman could be tempted.

Merino deal 'imminent'

It won't be 'if' but more 'when' Mikel Merino will join Arsenal.

Football.london claim: "It looks to be a matter of when, not if Arsenal complete the signing of Merino. Though an agreement is yet to have been reached between the two parties, the Spain arriving at Emirates Stadium looks to be close following this major breakthrough.

"Though there is over 20 days left for a deal to be agreed, the Gunners will be adamant for some major progress to be made over the next 48 hours in order to have Merino in the building before Saturday, August 17.

"Though Merino actually making his debut in that game is unlikely, given how Arteta has carefully bedded in Riccardo Calafiori, though seeing him in training and helping him develop relationships with his new teammates will be important to achieve as soon as possible."

Arsenal "can't win the league without a striker"

Man Utd legend Dwight Yorke claims Arsenal need to be a striker if they have designs on winning the league.

"Without a proper striker, Arsenal won’t win the Premier League," he told Champions League Betting.

"Arsenal haven’t been able to finish above Manchester City in the last two years because they haven’t got someone who can stick the ball in the net on a regular basis.

"If you look throughout the history of the Premier League, the teams who win the league have always got somebody who’s scoring 20 plus goals. It’s not rocket science for Mikel Arteta.

"They’re supposed to be the experts and have all the data and the know-how and the breakdowns of all the teams that have won the Premier League."

Zubimendi interest

Arsenal were never interested in signing Martin Zubimendi, according to reports.

The Real Sociedad star is currently in talks with Liverpool over a move.

The Gunners were said to be interested, but transfer expert Fabrizio Romano suggests that wasn't this summer.

He said: "Many clubs tried to convince Martin Zubimendi in the last couple of years - Barcelona, Bayern, Arsenal, many clubs spoke to the player, he wasn’t keen on the move.

"It’s important to clarify that Arsenal were NEVER negotiating for Zubimendi this summer."

More Arsenal training

Some more pictures from Mikel Arteta's training session as the Gunners prepare for their final pre-season friendly tomorrow.

Arsenal take on Lyon at the Emirates Stadium tomorrow afternoon in the Emirates Cup.

Cherry picking

TBR Football claim that Bournemouth have made enquiries about Eddie Nketiah with a view to jumping in on his proposed move to Marseille.

Nketiah looks set to call time on his spell with Arsenal and it seems the French giants are his most likely destination.

Despite Bournemouth's interest, it's claimed that Nketiah is focused on joining Marseille with boss Roberto de Zerbi pushing hard for the deal.

Gunners give Nketiah green light

Arsenal are continuing negotiations with Marseille over Eddie Nketiah.

The Gunners are in talks with the French giants over a season-long loan move with an obligatory fee of around £25m.

Marseille are yet to agree to those terms with discussions ongoing – having initially made an offer of around £17m for the player last month.

Personal terms are believed to already be in place on a five-year deal.

Arteta very involved in transfer dealings

It was revealed in the Athletic that Mikel Arteta is the driving force behind transfers at Arsenal.

While Edu takes charge of most of the scouting and negotiations, the two need joint sign-off on incomings.

Calafiori was a player that Arteta liked greatly and was instrumental in bringing him into the club.
